questions.text: An 18 year old female was sexually assaulted by a male. White stain was present on the clothes of the victim. Barberio’s test was performed on the stains to detect which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Spermine Barberio test reaction depends on the presence of spermine which comes from the prostate .

Highyeild:

Seminal Stains- Tests broadly divided into Chemical Tests: Acid Phosphatase Barberio’s Creatine Phosphokinase Florence Prostate specific antigen (PSA, P30) Microscopic Examination Chemical tests a. Acid phosphatase test - Secreted by prostate (prostatic epithelial cells) Activity of Acid phosphatase test in human semen is 500 – 1000 times greater than in any other body fluid. Normal acid phosphatase test activity in human semen is 340 – 360 Bodansky units per ml of semen. Concentration > 100 Bodansky units indicates that ejaculation occurred within 12 hours of examination Positive reactions are found upto 36 hrs after ejaculation in vaginal secretions. Acid phosphatase test – conclusive test in the absence of demonstrable sperm b. Barberio’s Test- Test / reaction depends on presence of spermine which comes from prostate Reaction gives a yellow, needle shaped, rhombic crystal of spermine picrate. C. Creatine Phosphokinase (CPK) Test - CPK – found both in spermatozoa and seminal ,plasma Normal seminal fluid contains , 385 -1400 units of CPK per ml Levels > 400 units are diagnostic of seminal stains The enzyme is stable and can be demonstrated in old stains of 6 months. d. Florence Test - Tests depend on the presence of choline in semen which comes from seminal vesicles. Choline is responsible for bluish – white fluorescence of seminal stains under UV light. Positive test gives dark brown, rhombic or needle shaped crystals of choline iodide, which resemble hemin crystals. This test is not specific for semen, as several substances of animal and vegetable origin give positive results. e. Prostate specific Antigen - PSA/ P30 - A glycoprotein produced by prostatic epithelial cells Detection of PSA – reliable indicator of semen Useful indicator in Azoospermia Microscopic Examination : The only absolute proof of semen is the microscope detection of at least one unbroken sperm. Complete sperms are seen upto 26 hrs in vagina, in the living, after ejaculation. After 26 hrs, they separate into head and tail. Similarly, after death complete sperms may be found upto 2 days in vagina and upto one week in the cervix & uterus.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Fructose- provides energy to the spermatozoa, it is not produced anywhere else in the body , provides a forensic test for Option B.Choline-Florence test depends on the presence of choline in semen which comes from seminal vesicles. Option D.Acid phosphatase-Concentration > 100 Bodansky units indicates that ejaculation occurred within 12 hours of examination

Extraedge:

Red stain: Luminol spray test (high sensitivity)- test of choice Spectroscopy (high specificity)- Most reliable test White stain: UV light Gold standard: presence of intact sperm under microscope (stain-christmas tree). Azoospermia-raised levels of Prostate specific antigen (P 30) + acid phosphatase.

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Most common mode of inorganic lead poisoning in industrial workers:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Inhalation Most common mode of lead poisoning in industrial workers is by inhalation of fumes and dust of lead.

Highyeild:

LEAD- Metallic lead is poisonous Chronic lead poisoning is called plumbism / Saturnism Features Facial pallor – circumoral facial pallor is the earliest manifestation of chronic poisoning of Blood picture Microcytic hypochromic anemia – Later it becomes Normocytic Normochromic. Punctate Basophilia, Basophilic stippling Blue colored (not basophils),Blue dots, pinhead size seen in cytoplasm of RBC. Eosinophilia Burtonian Blue Line Is seen at the junction of teeth & gums seen in those teeth which are infected / caries teeth because of decomposition of food, H2S is H2S + Lead→ Lead sulphide → causes blue line →seen in 50 –70% cases Colic & constipation – Seen in 85% of cases. Also called Dry Belly ache , Divons colic, Painter's colic. Lead Palsy – Seen in < 10% of cases, usually seen in adults . Affects muscles which are prone for fatigue . Presents with wrist drop, foot drop Lead encephalopathy is seen almost all cases of chronic lead poisoning Diagnosis : Coproporphyrin – III is valuable screening test Blood level > 0.07mg% Urine 0.15 – 0.3mg per litre Treatment : EDTA is Antidote of choice.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B and C. are other modes but not the most common. Ingestion due to contaminated hands , ingestion of small quantities of lead trapped in the upper respiratory tract and absorption through skin.

questions.text: In case of sea water drowning, which of the following abnormalities are noted: Hypernatremia Hyperkalemia Hemodilution Hyponatremia Myocardial anoxia Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,5 Sea water drowning causes hypernatremia and myocardial anoxia. Seawater is hypertonic , it shifts the fluid from blood to alveoli 🡪 Net decrease in blood volume 🡪 hemoconcentration 🡪 Increased viscosity of blood 🡪 Myocardial anoxia.

Highyeild:

Fresh water Drowning - Salinity of freshwater is 6 % NaCl. As the water enters the air passages and finally in alveoli → salinity is 0.6% Each of these alveoli is surrounded by an intense network of pulmonary vasculature carrying blood salinity of blood – 0.9 – 1% . Large amount of water moves from within the alveoli to pulmonary circulation→ This results in Hypervolemia→ Almost 3 – 3.5 litres fluid filled within 3 minutes → Sudden increased pumping capacity of heart → Cardiac arrhythmia → Ventricular tachycardia → Ventricular fibrillation . Because of hemodilution there will be swelling of cells which further results in lysis → Severe Hyperkalemia Hyponatremia Hypocalcemia Sea water Drowning- Salinity – 3.5% of NaCl The water enters the alveoli and the salinity is 3.5% NaCl Each of this alveoli is surrounded by intense network of pulmonary vasculature carrying blood, Salinity of blood→ 0.9-1.1% Large amount of fluid from pulmonary circulation enters the alveoli → Swelling of Alveoli → pulmonary Edema→ Asphyxia Each lung is about 3 kg Because of hemoconcentration , there is shrinking of cells → Hypokalemia → Hypernatremia Fatal period- Fresh water - 4 – 5 mins Sea water - 8 -10 mins

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Statement 2,3 and 4 are seen in Fresh water drowning. Therefore, Option A,B and D are incorrect.

Table:

#MANTRA Types of drowning- Wet drowning- primary drowning Dry drowning - 10-15%, laryngospasm , thick mucous→foam plug, panoramic views of past life, pleasant dreams without distress. Secondary drowning/post immersion syndromes /near drowning: Secondary drowning is death due to chemical or biological changes in the lungs after a near drowning incident : resuscitated an survives for 24 hours , +/- conscious, hypoxemia→ brain damage , electrolyte disturbances, pulmonary edema, hemoglobinuria, chemical pneumonitis Immersion syndrome / Cold water drowning : Cold water → Nerve endings ,strike epigastrium,entering ear drums, nasal passages. Horizontal entry (dive) → pressure on abdomen All these → Vagal inhibition → Cardiac arrest → death Mostly seen in suicide cases.

questions.text: A person in police custody was placed in a prone position with his wrist and ankles bound behind his back and secured with a rope. This method called?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hog-tying The type of physical restraint in which a person is placed in prone position with the wrist and ankles bound behind his back and secured with a rope is known as Hog tying.

Highyeild:

TORTURE Hog tying Both upper limbs are taken to the back and tied and lower limbs are bent over the back,upper limbs are tied to the lower limbs. La bandera Suspending a person by wrist Murcielago Suspending a person by ankles Cattle prod Frequent electric shock Falaka/falanga Continuously beating over sole Telefono Continuously beating over ears Dry submarine hands are tied at back and polythene cover is secured over neck and patient asked to breath through. Wet submarine Forcefully immersing the face into gutter or sewage water.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Falanga- It is a type of torture by beating on soles of feet. Option B. Carotid sleeper hold / lateral vascular neck restraint- The arm is placed about the neck with the antecubital fossa centered at the midline of the neck. Compresses carotid and jugular veins. Option D.Carotid hold / bar arm / choke hold – Placing the forearm straight across the front of the neck. The free hand grips the wrist and pulls it back causing airway obstruction and Carotid obstruction resulting in immediate unconsciousness.

questions.text: True about burns as shown in image:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Seen in lightning The given image shows filigree burns / Lichtenberg’s figures /arborescent markings typical of lightning strike. They are superficial, irregular and tortuous markings that resemble the branches of a tree .Most commonly seen over the shoulders, flanks and front of chest. They represent the path taken by the electrical discharge. If the person survives, they get resolved by themselves by 1 – 2 days.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B. Marbling- It is a postmortem finding seen when blood in the vessels is hemolyzed to sulfameth-hemoglobin , which stains the vessels walls and the adjacent tissues, giving rise to a marbled appearance. Commences at 24 hours and becomes prominent at 36 – 48 hours. Option C. Electrical burns – Joule burns, spark lesions and crocodile skin effects . Option D.Associated with thermal flame burns- cause dry,wrinkled,charred skin.

questions.text: Female skull brought by the police was analyzed in the forensic department. To consider this as female skull bone which features should be present: Prominent frontal and parietal eminence Narrow mastoid Small, smooth glabella Square orbits Heavy cheek bones Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2 and 3 Prominent frontal and parietal eminence, narrow mastoid and smooth glabella are the features of female skull.

Highyeild:

Trait Male Female Size Larger, longer Smaller, rounder Architecture Rugged Smooth Glabella Rough Smooth Supra orbital ridges Prominent Less prominent Cheek bones Heavier, laterally arched Lighter, compressed Zygomatic arch More prominent Less prominent Mastoid process Prominent, wide and long Less prominent, narrow and short Occipital region Marked muscle markings No marked muscle markings Frontal and parietal eminence Small Large Orbit Square with round margins Round with sharp margins Mandible Large, broad ramus Small, small ramus Chin shape U shaped V shaped

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Statement 4 and are seen in Male skull. Therefore Option A, B and C are incorrect.

questions.text: Match the following post mortem findings with their time of appearance: Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a-3, b-2, c-1, d-4 Option C. is the correct answer for Timings of events following death as mentioned below.

Highyeild:

Relaxation of urethral and anal sphincters – 24 h Marbling – Begins by about 24 hours and becomes prominent in 36 – 48 hours. Liquefaction – Begins by 5 days after death and becomes prominent in 10 days. Adipocere formation / corpse wax / grave wax / mortuary wax – usually between 3 to 6 months , but in countries like India, it is accelerated by the warm and humid weather , resulting in adipocere formation as early as 3 to 15 days.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B and D. are not the correct match.

questions.text: Match the following with the respective ages of fusion: Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a-1 b-2, c-3, d-4 Various age of epiphyseal fusion are : The medial end of the clavicle – 21 to 25 years Crista scapulae – 50 years Sacrum – 22 to 25 years Lambdoid suture – 45 years .

Highyeild:

Important tables of ossification center, its appearance and fusion , are given below. Shoulder Ossification center Appearance Fusion Shoulder Joint 1 year Humeral Head 1 year Greater Tubercle 3 years 18 years Lesser Tubercle 5 years Coracoid process 10–11 years 16 years Acromion Process 14–16 years 17–18 years Medial End of Clavicle 18–20 years 21–22 years Elbow joint centers Appearance Fusion Capitulum 1 year 14–16 years Medial epicondyle 5–7 years 16 years Trochlea 9 years 14–16 years Lateral epicondyle 11 years 13 years Upper end of radius 5 year 14–16 years 0lecronon process of ulna 9 years 14–16 years Wrist joint centers Appearance Fusion Lower end of radius 2 years 18–19 years Lower end of ulna 5–6 years 17–18 years Capitate 2 months–1 year - Hamate 3 months Triquetral 3 years Lunate 4 years Trapezium 5 years Trapezoid 6 years Scaphoid 5 years Pisiform 10–12 years Base of 1st metacarpal At birth 15 years Pelvis ossification centers Appearance Fusion Ischio-Pubic Ramus 6th year Triradiate cartilage 13–15 years Ischial tuberosity 16 years 20–22 years Iliac crest 14 years 18–20 years Head of Femur 1 year 17–18 years Greater Trochanter 4 years 17–18 years Lesser Trochanter 12–14 years 17–18 years Other important centers Appearance Fusion Basi-sphenoid fuses with the Basi-occiput 18–20 years Calcaneum 5 th I. U. Month Talus 7 th I. U. Month Lower end of Femur 9 th I. U. Month 18–19 years Upper end of Tibia At birth

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B and C. are incorrect matches.

Table:

#MANTRA All the ossification centers around the elbow joint will fuse with their respective shafts by 16 – 17 years ,hence the best X-ray to determine the age of 16 – 17 years is elbow joint. As head of femur, lesser trochanter and greater trochanter fuse by 17 -18 years ,the best X-ray to determine the age of 17 -18 years is the hip joint. Lower end of femur, upper end of tibia and upper end of fibula fuses by 18 – 19 years. Best X-ray for 18 – 19 years is the Knee joint. Upper end of femur, because iliac crest & ischial tuberosity fuses by 20 – 21 years . Best X-ray for 20 – 21 years is the Hip joint.

questions.text: Arrange the following in the correct order of occurrence of symptoms seen in iron toxicity: Asymptomatic phase Gastric bleeding Pyloric stenosis Liver failure and hypoglycemia Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

b 🡪a 🡪 d 🡪 c is the correct order of occurrence of symptoms seen in iron toxicity.

Highyeild:

Symptoms of iron toxicity: Stage Time Findings 1 within few hours Vomiting, abdominal pain, gastrointestinal bleeding, shock, acidosis and coma 2 6 – 24 hours Asymptomatic stage 3 24 – 48 hours Metabolic acidosis, jaundice, hypoglycemia, shock, coma with hepatic and renal failure 4 1 -2 weeks Late complication e.g. gastric stricture and pyloric stenosis

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,B and D. are not the correct sequence of Iron toxicity.
